snippet: When Alabama played Notre Dame in the 1973 Sugar Bowl, it was a national title game arranged not by computer rankings, but by the kind of primitive challenge heard in a sandlot.
abstract: Bill Pennington recalls when the 1973 Sugar Bowl between Alabama and Notre Dame, contest immediately billed as the game of the century; notes that Notre Dame defeated Alabama, 24-23, and won the AP title.
lead_paragraph: When Alabama played Notre Dame in the 1973 Sugar Bowl, it was a national title game arranged not by computer rankings, but by the kind of primitive challenge heard in a sandlot.

headline.seo: Before Computer Rankings and the Superdome, There Was Notre Dame vs. Alabama in the 1973 Sugar Bowl
headline.main: Epic Battle of Opposites: Irish vs. Tide in 1973
